node.excerpt:
When we moved to Spain, our daughters were 14 and 11 years old and just completed Year 9 and Year 6 in the UK. The youngest was due to start secondary school and the oldest her first year of GCSE. We really wanted them to immerse themselves into the Spanish culture and learn the language, but was a Spanish school the best option for them at this point in their lives?

There were a number of considerations, from choosing a school to ensuring they would settle in to their new life in a different…

frontmatter.title: Which school do I choose for my kids when moving to Spain?

node.excerpt: A couple of months after moving into a finca in the campo, I felt sorry for a pregnant mother cat and her four kittens who eventually emerged from the olive grove. She appeared well before them and all the more frequently when I started leaving food out for her. Today, the four kittens, one male and three females, are now semi-domesticated due to our care. The mother remains unapproachable but still turns up daily for food, along with her gang of other stray cats, around four of them - possibly…
